comment: run away this guy is terrible

DO NOT TAKE EIDSON! He has no respect for students and is useless. You can go to his class every day, take notes, pay attention, and spend 2 legitimate hours on the course every night and you will still go mad in this class and hate it. I learned nothing and he thought everyone was a programmer, when it was an intro course. DO NOT TAKE EIDSON!

Smart guy; he's just not a good teacher.  He rambles a lot, and much of his speech is ambiguous. He grades with a curve, but his exams are tricky.  You can take the same class over summer or take another CS class if you're an engineering student.

He is a bad teacher. If there is any way to take a class with some one else, do it. I took him for C++ programing and almost had a break down because of the class. I failed the first 3 tests and by the grace of God got an A on the last 2 and got an A in the class.

Terrible professor. 50% of the class dropped, under 25% pass rate. The material isn't very difficult, but Eidson delivers it in the most confusing manner possible; demanding an outrageous amount of pointless detail and grading on a system that only he understands. Either take this course over the summer or at another school, because he is horrid.

I cannot emphasize how bad this guy is. I can code fine but the amount of detail he wants is stupid. I pretty sure the best programmer in the world could fail this class only because he barely care about the code and ONLY the details. Wait till the summer semester to take C++ he is the only guy that ever teaches it unless it is the summer.

This guy is the worse teacher I have EVER had. DO NOT TAKE HIM if you can get away with it. He makes everyone in the class feel stupid every time they answer his questions. His tests make sense but his grading does not at all.
Not nearly as bad as others put it, but it's not an easy course, I'll put it that way.

DO NOT take this professor unless you are an experienced programmer.  He was so confusing and unhelpful that I had to drop the class. His classes are very large, about 100 students and he has no patience for the novice programmer. I recommend Professor John Vande-ven instead. Vande-Ven explains the subject matter much better & is willing to help u

Terrible professor, avoid him at all costs if you can. He drones on and on about insanely easy material in such a way that many students don't understand it despite it being very simple. He also spent around 75% of classes yelling at students for not doing enough homework, as if his homework assignments are the key to understanding programming.

All the reviews saying that you should avoid him are correct. Unless you already know programming, you're up a creek. He acts like he knows everything, but he doesn't know how to teach it to students. He also treats the 1301 class as an introduction to 1302. All assignments must be turned in on a Linux server via command prompt.

Excellent professor. Eidson may be tough but if you get through his class you will most definitely get a great education and come away a serious cut above other CS students. Clarity is lower due to the fact he wants you to learn problem solving so he tries to be vague. Helpfulness is lower because the class was so large it would be hard to be a 5.

The worst college professor I've had. His lectures are almost pointless, and he does nothing to help make the subject matter more clear. Unless you are an experienced programmer, you will probably be lost about halfway through the semester. For an introduction class he does a very bad job of explaining the material. Disrespectful of students also.

Alright heres the deal. He speaks the truth when talking about detail and precision, but when it comes to his own exam they are very unclear and full of holes. He weighs the in class design file way to much for being one hour to do in class, if you have to take him watch youtube on a channel call "the new boston" i wish i found the video WAY sooner

Most aggravating teacher I have ever met. All assignments must be turned into the Linux machine (of all OSs) on campus. He preaches about precision so much that you can never get an answer from him. He does very little teaching of the material and expects you to know it all already.
You had best be extremely knowledgeable to take from this guy and being psychic wouldn't hurt either. His tests are almost always unclear so you had best be lucky when trying to guess what he means.
Never met a Teacher like this... Unless expert in this subject, don't take him..

Stay away, this guy is not meant to be teaching. You cannot ask a question and get a straight response, you will never get out of lab on time or get a completion grade EVEN IF YOU ARE COMPLETE. Tests are extremely difficult and you better hope you have been coding since high school to keep up with his introduction course.
He is hard, very unclear but so is programming. Make sure you focus on the basics and always read ahead otherwise the lectures are pointless.
Don't Don't do it!!!!

Very unclear in everything he assigns. Tests are completely rediculous requiring students to write computer programs to meet very confusing and unclear directions. Mosts tests take minimum 4 hours to complete. I made an A but got a B because my final was "thin"...Avoid at all costs
